title: 3rd Class - Past Simple + Continuous lesson
description: This is to teach students the Past Simple and Continuous.

license.name: CC Naamsvermelding 4.0 Internationale licentie
license.description: De Internationale Creative Commons 4.0 licentie waarbij de gebruiker het werk mag kopiëren, verspreiden en doorgeven en afgeleide werken mag maken onder de voorwaarde: Naamsvermelding, zie http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/4.0/.

items.content:
Welcome students,

Today's lesson will be a bit different since instead of working through a PowerPoint and listening to me, you've to work through this website/lesson. The advantage is that you can do it at your own pace. So what exactly are you going to do today?

First, you're going to watch a video that explains today's theory. After watching the explanation you'll have to take a quiz. Then based on the score you achieve on the quiz, you'll have to work through a specific program. These programs are designed to help you. After completing the lesson you'll have to complete a small test to check if you've met today's goals.

Today's goal:

  • At the end of the class you know what the Past Simple and the Past Continuous are and how to use them.

I hope you enjoy the lesson and good luck!
Below you can find the video with the explanation of the Past Simple and Past Continuous. After watching it, please go to the next section called 'Placement quiz'.

items.caption: Kennisclip: Les + Past Simple en Continuous uitleg.

items.content:
In this section, you can find the placement test, after completing the test come back to this part and check how you've scored. Based on the percentage you'll have to follow a program, take a look below for which program you've to follow.

  • Comprehensive program - Below 50%.
  • Regular program - Between 50 and 80%
  • Challenging program - Above 80%.

Click the link to go to the quiz and check your percentage at the end of the quiz.

items.title: Placement Quiz
items.description: The quiz that you'll use to place yourself for one of the three programs. Make sure to turn Power-Ups off and don't cheat as the programs are made to help you.

items.content:
So you've finished the placement quiz, and you've to follow this program. This program focusses on supporting you with learning the past simple and past continuous. Watch the video, where I show you how I tackle an exercise where you have to use the past simple or the past continuous.

After watching the video, answer the questions below and continue to the regular program.

prompt.body: Waar moet je zowel op letten bij het maken van een exercise waarbij je moet kiezen tussen de past simple en continuous volgens de video?

values.value:
Een goed antwoord heeft het volgende opgenoemd:

  • Betekenis van de zin.
  • Wat het onderwerp is.
  • Welke tense je moet gebruiken door uit te zoeken welke regel hier geldt.
  • Hoe je de tense gebruikt.

content.body:
Een goed antwoord heeft het volgende opgenoemd:

  • Betekenis van de zin.
  • Wat het onderwerp is.
  • Welke tense je moet gebruiken door uit te zoeken welke regel hier geldt.
  • Hoe je de tense gebruikt.

items.content: After watching the video and answering the question, please continue to the regular program and follow that program.

Welcome to the regular program, in this program you will practice with a few small exercises. After completing the exercises you'll be able to view a Quizlet to help you with studying and you're supposed to complete a small test to see if today's goal has been met.
Below are a few sentences, conjugate the verb in brackets using the past simple or continuous so that it fits the sentence. You're allowed to write the number and behind it the verbs.

prompt.body:
1. The children ... (play) in the park when it started to rain.
  2. Lisa was watching Netflix when she ... (notice) him standing outside.
  3. We ... (not go) out because it was raining.
  4. The car ... (make) strange noises on our way home.
  5. My friends ... (not call) me yesterday.
  6. I ... (wake) up early this morning.
  7. He was playing with his football when you ... (call).
  8. Yesterday, I ... (go) to the movies with my wife.
  9. I ... (not sleep) all-day yesterday.
  10. I ... (not sit) in a cafe when you ...(call).

values.value:
Check the answers below to see if you've done the exercise correctly.

 

  1. The children were playing in the park when it started to rain.
  2. Lisa was watching Netflix when she noticed him standing outside.
  3. We didn't / did not go out because it was raining.
  4. The car was making strange noises on our way home.
  5. My friends didn't / did not call me yesterday.
  6. I woke up early this morning.
  7. He was playing with his football when you called.
  8. Yesterday, I went to the movies with my wife.
  9. I wasn't / was not sleeping all day yesterday.
  10. I wasn't / was not sitting in a cafe when you called.

content.body:
Check the answers below to see if you've done the exercise correctly.

  1. The children were playing in the park when it started to rain.
  2. Lisa was watching Netflix when she noticed him standing outside.
  3. We didn't / did not go out because it was raining.
  4. The car was making strange noises on our way home.
  5. My friends didn't / did not call me yesterday.
  6. I woke up early this morning.
  7. He was playing with his football when you called.
  8. Yesterday, I went to the movies with my wife.
  9. I wasn't / was not sleeping all day yesterday.
  10. I wasn't / was not sitting in a cafe when you called.

items.content:
When you learn English, it might be useful to know how to ask questions using correct grammar. In this exercise, you're going to turn sentences into questions.

Example

I woke up early this morning. Did you wake up early this morning?

prompt.body:
1. Lisa was watching Netflix for the entire day.
  2. He was playing soccer.
  3. The car made a strange noise yesterday.
  4. I walked the dog.
  5. John played the guitar when he was a child.
  6. I was doing the dishes when you called.
  7. Paul knew a famous singer.

values.value:
Check the answers below to see if you've done the exercise correctly.

 

  1. Was Lisa watching Netflix for the entire day?
  2. Was he playing soccer?
  3. Did the car make a strange noise yesterday?
  4. Did you walk the dog?
  5. Did John play the guitar when he was a child?
  6. Were you doing the dishes when I called?
  7. Did Paul know a famous singer?

content.body:
Check the answers below to see if you've done the exercise correctly.

  1. Was Lisa watching Netflix for the entire day?
  2. Was he playing soccer?
  3. Did the car make a strange noise yesterday?
  4. Did you walk the dog?
  5. Did John play the guitar when he was a child?
  6. Were you doing the dishes when I called?
  7. Did Paul know a famous singer?

items.content:
So you've completed every exercise, well done! Now you're almost ready to take the test. Before you do, check the Quizlet list below and practice the list once.

After doing that I want you to take the test and fill in a small survey about this lesson.

items.title: Past Simple and Past Continuous Quizlet

items.content:
Well done! You've completed the placement test with a very high score. This program is designed to be a bit more challenging so that you're not bored during this lesson.

The exercise consists of various challenging questions, after completing it, please take the test and fill in a small survey about this lesson.

If you do have trouble, although you had a high score, consider following the regular program.
Complete the sentences below, use the verb in brackets and use the past simple or past continuous.

prompt.body:
1. I ... (sit) in a bar when you ... (call).
  2. She ... (take) a shower when the telephone ...(ring)
  3. Why ... (sit) on a table when I ... (come) into the room?
  4. When her train ... (get) to the station, we ... (wait) on the platform.
  5. He ... (hear) a loud explosion while he ... (talk) to his friend.
  6. The students ... (play) a video game when the teacher ... (come) in.
  7. She ... (work) in a bank when she ... (meet) her husband.
  8. When Susan ...(leave) the house it ... (snow).
  9. While I ... (wait) for my plane, I ... (write) some emails.
  10. Tom ... (not have) long hair and a beard when he was in high school.

values.value:
Check the answers below to see if you've done the exercise correctly.

  1. I was sitting in a bar when you called.
  2. She was taking a shower when the telephone rang.
  3. Why were you sitting on a table when I came into the room?
  4. When her train got to the station, we were waiting on the platform.
  5. He heard a loud explosion while he was talking to his friend.
  6. The students were playing a video game when the teacher came in.
  7. She was working in a bank when she met her husband.
  8. When Susan left the house it was snowing.
  9. While I was waiting for my plane, I wrote some emails.
  10. Tom didn't have long hair and a beard when he was in high school.

content.body:
Check the answers below to see if you've done the exercise correctly.

  1. I was sitting in a bar when you called.
  2. She was taking a shower when the telephone rang.
  3. Why were you sitting on a table when I came into the room?
  4. When her train got to the station, we were waiting on the platform.
  5. He heard a loud explosion while he was talking to his friend.
  6. The students were playing a video game when the teacher came in.
  7. She was working in a bank when she met her husband.
  8. When Susan left the house it was snowing.
  9. While I was waiting for my plane, I wrote some emails.
  10. Tom didn't have long hair and a beard when he was in high school.

items.content:
Below are a few sentences, change the sentence into a question.

Example:

I went to the cinema -> Did you go to the cinema?

prompt.body:
1. I was doing homework this time last year.
  2. He was still sleeping when his wife left for work this morning.
  3. Lisa laughed after she heard the joke.
  4. Everyone was working when I arrived.
  5. Nora enjoyed the concert.

values.value:
Check the answers below to see if you've done the exercise correctly.

  1. What were you doing this time last year?
  2. Was he still sleeping when his wife left for work this morning?
  3. Did Lisa laugh after she heard the joke?
  4. Was everyone working when you arrived?
  5. Did Nora enjoy the concert?

content.body:
Check the answers below to see if you've done the exercise correctly.

  1. What were you doing this time last year?
  2. Was he still sleeping when his wife left for work this morning?
  3. Did Lisa laugh after she heard the joke?
  4. Was everyone working when you arrived?
  5. Did Nora enjoy the concert?

items.content:
So you've completed every exercise, well done! Now you're almost ready to take the test. Before you do, check the Quizlet list below and practice the list once.

After doing that I want you to take the test and fill in a small survey about this lesson.

heading.content: Test at the end of this lesson

items.content:
You've followed the program you had to follow and are now ready to do the test. By following the program and studying the Quizlet list, you will be able to pass the test with ease. The test can be found below, please fill in your name in the test and do your best to complete it.

After completing the test, please return to this page and fill in a small survey so that this lesson can be improved.

items.title: Past Simple and Past Continuous Test

items.content:
You've completed the test and because of that this lesson. I hope you've learned something during the lesson and would like to ask you to fill in a small survey. It's anonymous and used to improve the lessons when using this website and when I'm teaching.

Thank you.

headings.title: Test at the end of this lesson
